#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Register a Boat
#Text=If you ’re planning to get a motorized boat , make sure you follow the law regarding registration .
#Text=Just like cars , states require boats to be registered .
#Text=Registration lets the authorities know who ’s operating boats legally on a given waterway .
#Text=States vary when it comes to boat registration rules and fees .
#Text=Before you go out on the water in your boat , check with the appropriate state agency to ensure you ’re in compliance .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Submitting Your Boat Registration
#Text=Get a boat registration application from the appropriate state agency .
#Text=You ’re required to register your boat in the state where you keep it .
#Text=States vary when it comes to the agencies that handle boat registration .
#Text=Common state agencies that handle boat registration include the Department of Motor Vehicles , the Department of Fish and Game or the state agency specifically dedicated to managing waterways .
#Text=You can pick up an application from the appropriate state agency in-person or download one from the agency ’s website .
#Text=If you just bought a brand new boat , the dealer most likely will give you a boat registration application and tell you where to send it .
#Text=You can also search online to find out which agency in the state where you park your boat handles registration .
#Text=Fill out the boat registration application .
#Text=Boat registration applications are detailed and ask for information such as your name and address .
#Text=You have to state truthfully that you are the owner of the boat and attach proof of ownership .
#Text=You also must provide details about what the boat is made out of as well as the hull identification number .
#Text=On your boat registration application , be prepared to state truthfully that you have paid taxes on your boat .
#Text=Gather your proof of ownership documents .
#Text=You ’re required to show proof of ownership of your boat .
#Text=A boat title in your name is the best proof of ownership , but if you do n’t have one , a bill of sale , which is basically a sales receipt for your boat , works fine .
#Text=If you bought the boat and have n’t yet paid off the owner , you can provide your sales contract as proof of ownership .
#Text=Be prepared to show documentation of any loans you have on your boat as part of the registration process .
#Text=Mail in the application , copies of supporting documents and fee .
#Text=Boat registration fees vary widely among the states but are mostly affordable .
#Text=In most cases , you can expect to pay less than $ 100 for the boat registration sticker and documents combined .
#Text=You can drop off the application in person or send it to the appropriate state government agency by mail .
#Text=Send your payment for initial registration by personal check , cashier ’s check or money order .
#Text=Avoid sending cash .
#Text=If you drop off your application in person , you might be able to pay with your credit card .
#Text=Affix your registration number to your boat with paint or decals .
#Text=When the state processes your boat registration , you ’ll get a registration number and a decal to put on your boat .
#Text=With rare exceptions , you ’re required to display your registration number and the decals on both sides of the front half of your boat .
#Text=You can purchase waterproof block letters at your local boating or home improvement store .
#Text=It ’s a good idea to purchase waterproof paint and block letter and number stencils so that your registration number is in compliance and easy to read from a distance .
#Text=Boat registrations usually expire after two years and must be renewed .
#Text=Renewing Your Boat Registration
#Text=Review the boat registration renewal notice that you got in the mail .
#Text=States usually send out registration renewal notices two months in advance of expiration .
#Text=Review the notice carefully to find out if there are any required changes you need to make to be in compliance .
#Text=For example , occasionally , the U.S. Coast Guard may require certain registration numbers to be changed .
#Text=Should this happen , you would be required to remove the old registration number and display the new registration number to avoid a fine .
#Text=Create an account and log-in to your state ’s licensing renewal website .
#Text=Most states require initial registration by mail or in person and allow registration renewal online .
#Text=The website you ’re supposed to use is listed on your renewal notice .
#Text=Follow the prompts online to complete your registration renewal .
#Text=If you do n’t have a laptop with you at the time of renewal , do n’t worry .
#Text=Most registration renewal websites can be accessed on your smartphone .
#Text=You can also renew your boat registration by mail or in person if you so choose , depending on the state .
#Text=Pay your boat registration renewal fee online with a credit card .
#Text=States that process registration renewals online usually accept a variety of credit cards .
#Text=You might also be able to pay the renewal fee using a service like Paypal , depending on the state .
#Text=Pay your boat registration renewal fee by check , money order or cashier 's check if you send in your renewal form by mail .
#Text=Your boat registration number may not change , but you ’ll be sent a new decal to put alongside it .
#Text=Tips
#Text=While waiting for your registration , your state agency or boat dealer can issue you a temporary registration which allows you to park and use your boat .
#Text=You do n’t need to register a non-motorized boat like a canoe or kayak .
#Text=You may , however , need a permit to use your non-motorized boat , depending on park or waterway regulations .
#Text=Remember , as long as your boat is properly registered in the state where you normally keep it , you do n’t need to register your boat in another state if you ’re just visiting .
#Text=Most states allow visitors to bring and use their boats for a limited amount of time without registration .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=It ’s vitally important to follow boat registration rules in the state where you park your boat and states you visit for boating .
#Text=Failure to comply may result in fines .
